item.title: My recipes
item.description:
Welcome to my recipe collection! Here are some of my favorite dishes to cook at home.

I - Tartiflette Savoyarde

The ultimate comfort food from the French Alps. Potatoes, melted Reblochon cheese, smoky lardons, and onions.

Tartiflette:

ğŸ›’ Ingredients

  • Potatoes: At least 8 medium-sized
  • Onions: 2 small
  • Cheese: 2 half-slices of Reblochon (or 1 whole Reblochon cut horizontally)
  • Meat: 1 package of lardons (bacon strips/cubes)
  • Seasoning:
    • 1 clove of garlic
    • 2 tbsp olive oil
    • Salt & Pepper
    • Oregano & Herbes de Provence

ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ³ Preparation

1. Prep the potatoes

Place the potatoes in a large pot of water. Bring to a boil and cook on low heat for 15 minutes. Tip: Do not fully cook them, they will finish cooking in the oven.

item.title: Automated Value Investing Tool
item.description:
• Git of the project : https://github.com/Alexis-Ribat/value_investing.git

Project Overview

Context & Problem Statement

While there is no shortage of commercial stock screeners, I found them lacking in transparency and flexibility. I needed a tailored solution that would allow me to:

  • Customize dashboards based on my specific Value Investing criteria.
  • Audit the calculations of key performance indicators (ROE, ROCE, Free Cash Flow) to ensure they match my valuation models.
  • Automate qualitative analysis using my own predefined AI prompts to mimic a specific investor persona.

Proposed Solution

To address this, I built the Value Investing Dashboard, a self-hosted financial analysis platform designed to automate fundamental stock research.
